title-group.article-title: Option Pricing: Dividends and the in- and out-of-the-Money Bias

abstract.p: This paper is concerned primarily with the recent contradictory evidence concerning the pricing of in- and out-of-the-money options. It will be shown that the empirical evidence concerning this bias may be explained by a previously undetected dividend bias. That is, results will be presented indicating that the magnitude of the dividend on the underlying stock influences the over or underpricing of in- and out-of-the-money options. This dividend-induced behavior persists even with the use of a recently developed option pricing model which specifically accounts for dividends.
